summary.para: Disassembles a section of compiled Microsoft High Level Shader Language (HLSL) code that is specified by shader trace steps.

param.name: pSrcData
param.para: A pointer to compiled shader data.

param.name: SrcDataSize
param.para: The size, in bytes, of the block of memory that pSrcData points to.

param.name: pTrace
param.para: A pointer to the ID3D11ShaderTrace interface for the shader trace information object.

param.name: StartStep
param.para: The number of the step in the trace from which D3DDisassemble11Trace starts the disassembly.

param.name: NumSteps
param.para: The number of trace steps to disassemble.

param.name: Flags
param.para: A combination of zero or more of the following flags that are combined by using a bitwise OR operation. The resulting value specifies how D3DDisassemble11Trace disassembles the compiled shader data.

item.description: Enable the output of color codes.
Enable the output of default values.
Disable the output of debug information.
Enable the output of instruction offsets.

description.para: Enable the output of the instruction cycle per step in D3DDisassemble11Trace. This flag is similar to the D3D_DISASM_ENABLE_INSTRUCTION_NUMBERING and D3D_DISASM_ENABLE_INSTRUCTION_OFFSET flags.
This flag has no effect in the D3DDisassembleRegion function. Cycle information comes from the trace; therefore, cycle information is available only in the trace disassembly.

param.name: ppDisassembly
param.para: A pointer to a buffer that receives the ID3DBlob interface that accesses the disassembled HLSL code.

returns.para: This method returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: D3DDisassemble11Trace walks the steps of a shader trace and outputs appropriate disassembly for each step that is based on the step's instruction index. The disassembly is annotated with register-value information from the trace. The behavior of D3DDisassemble11Trace differs from D3DDisassemble in that instead of the static disassembly of a compiled shader that D3DDisassemble performs, D3DDisassemble11Trace provides an execution trace that is based on the shader trace information.
